description.raw:
This pull request fix the SSE detection on the ARM architecture. SSE is only present on x86.

I'm importing a cmake module which is able to get the system architecture by compiling a piece of c code, there is no native cmake command or module for this, AFAIK.

While fixing this, I've found that the SSE4 detection code seems broken to me, nothing is setting the ENABLE_SSE4 variable. We probably need to fix Gazebo too.

I've also create an ARM -any- job in jenkins which runs on docker + qemu.
[The testing run](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_math-any-devel-trusty-armhf/5) corresponding to this pull request.

While fixing this, I've found that the SSE4 detection code seems broken to me, nothing is setting the ENABLE_SSE4 variable. We probably need to fix Gazebo too.

I've also create an ARM -any- job in jenkins which runs on docker + qemu. The testing run corresponding to this pull request.

title.raw: Fix SSE detection on ARM (and SSE4 on x86)
